intro: Dodecatheon dentatum subsp. utahense, commonly known as the Utah glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with serrated margins, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
